meanings.definition: A small hot-tasting pod of a variety of capsicum, used in cooking.
meanings.sent1: I added some chillis to the curry for extra spice.
meanings.sent2: The recipe calls for a couple of chillis to be chopped finely.
meanings.sent3: The chillis in the stew were so fiery, they made everyone sweat!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a burst of chillis, spreading warmth and joy.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant red chillis on the plant looked like little flames dancing in the wind.

meanings.definition: A hot-tasting powder made from dried and ground chilli peppers.
meanings.sent1: Sprinkling some chillis on the pizza gave it a nice kick.
meanings.sent2: The chillis added a spicy flavor to the dish.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally sneezed after inhaling the chillis while cooking.
meanings.sent4: The music was so loud, it felt like a storm of chillis in my ears.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly ground chillis filled the kitchen with warmth and heat.
